snippet: Many voters oppose higher taxes as a fix-all to the government’s problems but say they could stomach a deal that had fair tax increases if it included spending cuts.
abstract: Many voters across nation oppose higher taxes as fix-all to government’s problems but say they could accept a deal that had fair tax increases if it included spending cuts,  indicating a more nuanced view of tax increases than public debates suggest.
lead_paragraph: Many voters oppose higher taxes as a fix-all to the government’s problems but say they could stomach a deal that had fair tax increases if it included spending cuts.

headline.seo: Voters Want Fiscal Deal to Include Spending Cuts
headline.main: How to Sell a U.S. Tax Increase Back Home: Make Sure to Cut Spending, Too
headline.print_headline: How to Sell a U.S. Tax Increase Back Home: Make Sure to Cut Spending, Too
